title: Ticket #3402: file transfer race condition in parallel universe
description:
When using parallel universe, it is possible for the job to be marked as finished without transferring the output from some nodes in the job. There is a race between node 0 reporting its exit status and output being transferred from all the other nodes.

When file transfer in the shadow uses blocking mode, the race is between initiation of transfer and processing the exit status of node 0. When non-blocking file transfer is used in the shadow (as in #3333), the race is between completion of file transfer and processing the exit status of node 0. In both cases, some nodes may not get a chance to transfer any files at all. In the non-blocking case, the transfers for some nodes may be halted midway.
remarks:
2012-Dec-28 15:02:43 by danb:
The race condition goes away if the attribute ParallelShutdownPolicy is set to "WAIT_FOR_ALL". The default is "WAIT_FOR_NODE0". Therefore, I think the race condition is actually expected behavior.
